titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lawrence Gregg Thomas papers SC1393
titlestmt.author: Jenny Johnson

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-02-01 11:19:56 -0800.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, syllabi, lecture outlines, notes, and printed matter, relating mainly to the philosophy of education.
did.physloc: Special Collections and University Archives materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36-48 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lawrence Gregg Thomas papers (SC1393). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1981. Transferred to Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: American educator; professor of education, Stanford University, 1939-1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, syllabi, lecture outlines, notes, and printed matter, relating mainly to the philosophy of education.
